numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Talking with parents in person has decreased.
2. Talking with parents in person has become less relevant.
3. Texting is the least common way to talk with parents.
4. Between 50% and 70% of men text their parents.
5. Between 50% and 70% of women text their parents.
6. Between 30% and 55% of men contact their parents through video calls.
7. Between 30% and 55% of women contact their parents through video calls.
8. Between 17% and 25% of men contact their parents in person.
9. Between 17% and 25% of women contact their parents in person.
10. I wonder whether phones affect how often people contact their parents compared to in-person contact.
11. I wonder how the rates change over the years.
12. I wonder whether in-person contact will end.
13. This topic relates to me and my community.
14. My generation grew up with smartphones.
15. Everyone in my generation uses a smartphone.
16. Some people use phones to avoid their parents when there is conflict.
17. Some people do not talk with their parents maturely in person.
18. The headline is: Has in-person contact become irrelevant?
